review_blob: Upland keep los it on their fruit sours. All seem so well balanced from fruit to oak to musty barnyard characters. This one had great strawberry aroma that added to their dimension from the funky tart brews. a++
750 bottle, wonderful peach and funky barnyard aroma. Taste tart but not too sour, perfectly balanced with the wordy and tart pucker and p achy nose. Absolutely fantastic.
Cherries tart and funk, no head champagne carbonation. One of best around. So well balanced. Perfect in my opinion.

Have had lambics and fruit lambics for years. Had this in blueberry and then this the peach. Very consistent with the style as with the blueberry. Same base beer I guess. Taste tart and funky sour fought and breads sour as a sour Belgian is. Oaky and funky. Peaches danced around all over. Very peachy but not set peach but more of a nose and olfactory peach. The sour dominated and peach added the perfect balance. Orange and cloudy champagne like carbonation with no head. As mentioned before the balance of fruits and tarts were phenomenal.

Have enjoyed sours for decades. Nice to see this style coming around at small breweries. Intense blueberry aroma from light reddish cloudy yeasty pour. Clearer if I did not rouse bottle. Notes of tart sourdough yeasty Belgian style fragrance with the blueberries. Taste is funky tart with some oak and leather. Extremely dry and crisp like a champagne with lemon zest. The blueberries float around the tongue like a vodka effervescent of fresh blueberries. The balance kept me asking if I liked the blueberries or the sourness funk stuff.

Poured tap at source. Clear dark red. Like a garnet jewel. Aroma of toffe malts no roast. Some hops present but all about malty aroma. Super fresh malty toffe taste with the 9+ percent alcohol hidden. Finishes well with no sweetness, just malty joy.
beer_name: Oceanside Ale Works American Strong Ale

review_blob: Killed it on aroma. Could smell it it was brought to me. Pine grass and mango. Super fresh hoppy flavor. Light malts and near perfect finish.
Really really good. Clear orange pour. Nice hop aroma with carbonation brings no out pine and fruity hop aroma. Taste bitter as a good IPA should. Pleasantly impressed.

Damn good for an Amber red. Clear garnet pour nice white head. Mellow malts with some toffee. A hard beer to appease the big players in RB world but appreciate this for what it is. Session and great taste.
Good light mellow IPA. No big aroma. Some peachy mango happiness in aroma and taste. Would be better rated as a single IPA.
Old hop earthy nose. Cloudy and pillowy foam head. Seemed it could have been great but seems old or dirty lines. Great place here at Bagby but beer was not too fresh.
Overly malty aroma Amber pour, sticky sweet. Hops are earthy. Flavor is cloyingly sweet. Tough to muscle down pint. May be to some liking.
Orange cloudy pour no head. Love got light carbonation. Hops there nothing outstanding. Decent iOS overall but nothing to write home about.
Orange pour clear with some haze. Citrus hop aroma. Taste bitter and green hops defiantly northwest style hops. Great IPA.
Excellent apricot and peachy aroma. The flavor and palate is fantastic like an apricot cognac. Heat is slight and adds to character. Once again apricot brany cognac. Really really good!

Wonderful sour grape and peach wine aroma. Very cherry wine like flavor with tons if oak and malt supports. Perfect dry palate and carbonation. Light and lively but not American lager type of mouthfeel. More champagne like. Excellent!

Cloudy dark orange garnet. Bottle conditioned from sediment I guess. Cherry aroma is fantastic, nose blowing, cherry bomb. Flavor is equal as big in cherry with cherry skin tartness. Very light in mouthfeel. Very very dry and light carbonation. Finished with the typical awesome funk found in the best krieks. Brett, barnwood, wet lumberyard. Excellent kriek.
beer_name: Oceanside Ale Works Up A Kriek

review_blob: Best fruit sour this brewery made. Smashing great blueberry nose aroma flavor all way through to crisp dry light carbonation and finish. Perfect lambic funk and cheese and Brett. Great oaky maple character from cellaring. Get this when ever you can

Awesomeness....like a raspberry fruit champagne with barnwood notes. May be too carbonated for style but the fact it was fruity and dry made it great. Syrupy carbonation is lke cherry cola, this is opposite with brite cherry raspberry notes and flavors with a nice malt oak wheat backbone! Perfect.

Cherry and cellar aroma. Basement sour cherry aftertaste and huge cherry lambic flavor. Ruby red. No carbonation, perfect tart dryness and super dry crisp finish. Love the barnwood cellar after tones.

This one was way better than their raspberry lambic. Great cherry nose. No real head and minimal carbonation. Flavors of cheery all way through with excellent dry funk lambic palate and finish. Superb.
Raspberry jam great raspberry and cherry aroma. Palate us thuck and cloy sweet. A little too much like my krueks and fruit lambics drier. Still good brew.
Cherries and Brett in nose. Nice taste balance if oak blue cheese and bing cherries. Tart cherry skin mouthfeel. Great beer.
Pretty good. Simple cherries, some funk, mostly tart, good carbonation, good summer beer by the H20.
Blueberry aroma was fantastic. A bit too much in the flavor and somewhat cloying. May be with time will get better. Great tartness, only complaint is thickness from fruit. Could get better
WOW huge Raspberry aroma coukld smell across the room. Taste as much too but not too thick. Would like to try an aged bottle to see how funk come through.
Excellent....sour but balanced with slight moldy wood. Some blue chesse aroma very complex yet balanced. Flavor of lemon grapefruit citrus. great!
Clody pale with some floaters. Expected. Very sour tart lemon citrus. Very drinkable with slight brett in finish.
Real lemon and lime...good if thats what you like...me id like more funk. but good brew Id have it again.
Nice golden color with some floaters. But no prpoblem. very sour and barnwood aroma. Very dry excellent tart green apple ,and sour mellon. Very refreshing.
pale yellow with slight orange glow...no head slight bubbles. Mead cider notes, verry dry, which I really like. Flavor is tart cider with apple and sour orange. Great Lambic

Going down the list of my fav style. This one like others are a rough find. 750 Bottle good price. fantastic aroma of pear, sour mellon and green apple tart. Flavor was initial brett and real tart. Great balance. Excellent to style. Love it when a US beer can do that

<perPerfection...dark orange almost no carbonation but just enoughg. Tart apple pear.Wonderful. A perfect example. hard to find true unblened lambics...this one pretty available. going down the list of the ones i can find

brite yellow orange, light carbonation flattened out quickly, sour vinegar nose and real green apple aroma. Flavor is excellent tart brett hay etc. One of best examples. Hard to find real unbleneded lambics in US
